page.title: 04WILDLIFE CONTINUED
page.content: {HARE:}SOLITARY, MAINLY ACTIVE DURING THE EVENING. MOST LIKELY TO BE SEEN IN OPEN FIELDS. FEEDS ON BARK AND OTHER VEGETATION. {MOLE:}ACTIVE DURING THE DAY AND NIGHT. LIKELY TO BE SEEN ON OPEN GRASSLAND. FEEDS ON EARTHWORMS. {HEDGEHOG:}ALMOST ENTIRELY NOCTURNAL. HIBERNATES FROM OCTOBER TO APRIL. FEEDS ON SLUGS, WORMS, INSECTS AND FUNGI. {COMMON SHREW:}MOST LIKELY TO BE SEEN IN THORPE WOOD ON THE CASTLE EDEN WALKWAY. EATS MAINLY INSECTS, WORMS AND SPIDERS. {HARVEST MOUSE:}CAN BE SEEN IN HEDGEROWS OR CORNFIELDS. VERY DIFFICULT TO OBSERVE. FEEDS ON SEEDS AND FRUITS.
